result.execSummary:
The defendant Carolyn J Maxwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carolyn J Maxwell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carolyn J Maxwell was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Carolyn J Maxwell was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 4 Days.

Court will consider early termination of Probation after 6 months.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $100.00 per month starting 07-01-2015.  Failure to pay the Court orders 4 days Huber as Contempt for non-compliance with Court Order.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Defendant's probation is hereby terminated effective February 11, 2016.
Filed by State; no objection on early termination of probation.
From Court to State requesting position on petition for early discharge
dated 1/22/16 from Probation and Parole recommending early discharge of probation.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Carolyn J Maxwell in court with attorney Gerald Philip Boyle.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 2 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 is dismissed.

COUNT 2

The Court Orders the Following:

Withheld Sentence of:
(Credit - 4 days)

Term of Probation: 12 months  Court will consider early termination of probation after 6 months.

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Perform  10 hours of community service within the first 10 months;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License.

Costs: $243.00 



COUNT 3

The Court Orders the Following:

Withheld Sentence of:

Term of Probation: 12 months   CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2

Conditions of Probation:  SAME AS COUNT 2

Costs: $243.00 

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation at the rate of $100.00  per month commencing 7-1-15.  Failure to pay the Court orders 4 days Huber as contempt for non-compliance with Court Order.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Carolyn J Maxwell in court with attorney Gerald Philip Boyle.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Carolyn J Maxwell in court with attorney Gerald Philip Boyle.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to possess any firearms. Comply with the civil injunction file #14CV2525.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Carolyn J Maxwell in court, in custody.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant would like to speak with attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
